radiographic_examinations.findings: A new right PICC line terminates in the mid-to-lower SVC without complications. New hazy opacity is identified in the right lung base, suggestive of aspiration. The previously noted retrocardiac opacity is now worsened, completely obliterating the left hemidiaphragm, also containing air bronchograms, consistent with consolidation or/and atelectasis. There is increase in bilateral small pleural effusions, left greater than right. Upper lungs are clear. No evidence of fluid overload or pneumothorax. Cardiomediastinal contour is stable.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The previously noted retrocardiac opacity is worsened, completely obliterating the left hemidiaphragm. There is an increase in bilateral small pleural effusions.
